gurmukhi: < siqgur pRswid ]
transliteration: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?
translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

gurmukhi: 1 siqgur dI mihNmw, gurU snmuK qy vymuK dw AMq
transliteration: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?
translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

gurmukhi: siqgur purKu AgMmu hY inrvYru inrwlw
transliteration: Satigur Purakhu Aganmu Hai Niravairu Niraalaa.
translation: The true Guru is inaccessible, without rancour and extraordinary.

gurmukhi: jwxhu DrqI Drm kI scI Drmswlw
transliteration: Jaanahu Dharatee Dharam Kee Sachee Dharamasaalaa.
translation: Consider earth as the true abode of dharma.

gurmukhi: jyhw bIjY so luxY Pl krm smHwlw
transliteration: Jayhaa Beejai So Lounai Phalu Karam Samhaalaa.
translation: Here karmas take care of the fruits i.e. one reaps what he sows.

gurmukhi: ijau kir inrmlu AwrsI jgu vyKix vwlw
transliteration: Jiu Kari Niramalu Aarasee Jagu Vaykhani Vaalaa.
translation: He (the Lord) is the mirror in which the world can see its face reflected.

gurmukhi: jyhw muhu kir BwlIAY qyho vyKwlw
transliteration: Jayhaa Muhu Kari Bhaaleeai Tayho Vaykhaalaa.
translation: One would see the same face he will carry before the mirror.

gurmukhi: syvk drgh surKrU vymuK muhu kwlw ]1]
transliteration: Sayvaku Daragah Surakharoo Vaymoukhu Muhu Kaalaa ?1?
translation: The servants of God remain red faced and triumphant whereas the apostates keep their faces blackened.

gurmukhi: 2 gur gopU cylw
translation: The disciple hiding the Guru

gurmukhi: jo gur gopY Awpxw ikau isJY cylw
transliteration: Jo Gur Gopai Aapanaa Kiu Sijhai Chaylaa.
translation: If the disciple does not know (tell) about his guru, how could he get liberated.

gurmukhi: sMglu Giq clweIAY jm pMiQ iekylw
transliteration: Sangalu Ghati Chalaaeeai Jam Panthi Ikaylaa.
translation: Bound in chains, he is forced to walk alone on the way of the Yama, death.

gurmukhi: lhY sjweI nrk ivic auhu Krw duhylw
transliteration: Lahai Sajaaeen Narak Vichi Uhu Kharaa Duhaylaa.
translation: In dilemma he stands and suffers hell.

gurmukhi: lK caurwsIh BauidAwN iPir hoie n mylw
transliteration: Lakh Chauraaseeh Bhaudiaan Dhiri Hoi N Maylaa.
translation: Though he transmigrates in the eighty four lac species of life yet he does not meet the Lord.

gurmukhi: jnmu pdwrQu hwirAw ijau jUey Kylw
transliteration: Janamu Padaaradu Haariaa Jiu Jooay Khaylaa.
translation: Like the playing of gamble, he loses the invaluable stake of life in this game.

gurmukhi: hQ mroVY isru DunY auhu lhY n vylw ]2]
transliteration: Had Marorhai Siru Dhounai Uhu Lahai N Vaylaa ?2?
translation: At the end (of life) he has jitters and lamentations but the time gone never returns.

gurmukhi: 3 gur gopU bymuK hY
translation: Guru prevaricator is apostate

gurmukhi: Awip n vM\\Y swhury isK lok suxwvY
transliteration: Aapi N Vanai Saahuray Sikh Lok Sounaavai.
translation: The Guru prevaricator is similar to a girl who herself goes not to the father-in law's house and gives precepts to others.

gurmukhi: kMqu n puCY vwqVI suhwgu gxwvY
transliteration: Kant N Pouchhai Vaatarhee Suhaagu Ganaavai.
translation: Her husband never cares for her and she sings paeans of her happy married life.

gurmukhi: cUhw Kf n mwveI lik Cju vlwvY
transliteration: Choohaa Khad N Maavaee Laki Chhaju Valaavai.
translation: It is such as the rat itself cannot enter the hole but roams tied winnowing tray to its waist.

gurmukhi: mMqu n hoie ATUihAw hQu spIN pwvY
transliteration: Mantu N Hoi Atdoohiaan Hadu Sapeen Paavai.
translation: It is such a person as not knowing even the mantra of a centipede lays his hand on a snake.

gurmukhi: sru sMnHY Awgws no iPir mQY AwvY
transliteration: Saru Sannhai Aagaas No Dhiri Madai Aavai.
translation: The person who facing towards sky shoots the arrow receives the arrow on his own face.

gurmukhi: duhI srweIN jrdrU bymuK pCuqwvY ]3]
transliteration: Duhee Saraaeen Jarad Roo Baymoukh Pachhoutaavai ?3?
translation: The apostate is yellow faced, frightened in both the worlds and repents.

gurmukhi: 4 bymuK rs nhIN lYNdw
translation: The apostate cannot enjoy

gurmukhi: rqn mxI gil bwNdrY ikhu kIm n jwxY
transliteration: Ratan Manee Gali Baandarai Kihu Keem N Jaanai.
translation: The monkey knows no worth of the jewellary tied to its neck.

gurmukhi: kVCI swau n sMmHlY Bojn rsu KwxY
transliteration: Karhachhee Saau N Sanmhalai Bhojan Rasu Khaanai.
translation: Even being in the food, the ladle does not know the taste of the dishes.

gurmukhi: ffU ickiV vwsu hY kvlY n is\\wxY
transliteration: Dadoo Chikarhi Vaasu Hai Kavalay N Siaanai.
translation: The frog always lives in mire but still knows not the lotus.

gurmukhi: nwiB kQUrI imrg dY iPrdw hYrwxY
transliteration: Naabhi Kadooree Mirag Dai Dhiradaa Hairaanai.
translation: Having musk in its navel the deer runs around confused.

gurmukhi: gujru gorsu vyic kY Kil sUVI AwxY
transliteration: Gujaru Gorasu Vaychi Kai Khali Soorhee Aanai.
translation: The cattle breeder puts the milk on sale but fetches home, the oil cakes and husk.

gurmukhi: bymuK mUlhu GuiQAw duK shY jmwxY ]4]
transliteration: Baymoukh Moolahu Ghudiaa Doukh Sahai Jamaanai ?4?
translation: The apostate is a person basically gone astray and he undergoes the sufferings given by the Yama.

gurmukhi: 5 bymuK huMidAwN suMidAwN duKI
translation: The apostate posseses everything but still is unhappy

gurmukhi: swvix vix hrIAwvly sukY jwvwhw
transliteration: Saavani Vani Hareeaavalay Soukai Jaavaahaa.
translation: In the month of savan, the whole forest becomes green but javels, a prickly plant remains dry.

gurmukhi: sB ko srsw vrsdy JUry jolwhw
transliteration: Sabh Ko Sarasaa Varasadai Jhooray Jolaahaa.
translation: During rains every one feels delighted but the weaver is seen gloomy.

gurmukhi: sBnw rwiq imlwvVw ckvI dorwhw
transliteration: Sabhanaa Raati Milaavarhaa Chakavee Doraahaa.
translation: In the night all the pairs meet but for chakavi , that is the time of separation.

gurmukhi: sMKu smuMdhu sKxw rovY dy Dwhw
transliteration: Sankhu Samoundahu Sakhanaa Rovai Day Dhaahaa.
translation: The conch remains empty even in the ocean and cries when blown.

gurmukhi: rwhhu auJiV jo pvY musY dy Pwhw
transliteration: Raahahu Ujharhi Jo Pavai Mousai Day Dhaahaa.
translation: The man gone astray will definitely be robbed by putting rope around his neck.

gurmukhi: iqau jg AMdir bymuKwN inq auBy swhw ]5]
transliteration: Tioun Jag Andari Baymoukhaan Nit Oubhay Saahaa ?5?
translation: Similarly, the apostates go on sobbing in this world.

gurmukhi: 6 bymuK ig`dV dwK hY, Awpxw doS dUey nUM
translation: The apostate puts blame on others   ,

gurmukhi: igdV dwK nw ApVY AwKY QUh kauVI
transliteration: Gidarh Daakh N Aparhai Aakhai Dooh Kaurhee.
translation: The jackal cannot reach the grapes and says disdainfully that grapes are sour.

gurmukhi: ncxu nic nw jwxeI AwKY Buie sauVI
transliteration: Nachanu Nachi N Jaanaee Aakhai Bhui Saurhee.
translation: The dancer knows no dance but says that the place is narrow.

gurmukhi: bolY AgY gwvIAY BYrau so gauVI
transliteration: Bolai Agai Gaaveeai Bhairau So Gaurhee.
translation: Before a deaf person singing in measure Bhairav or Gaul is the same.

gurmukhi: hMswN nwil ttIhrI ikau phucY dauVI
transliteration: Hansaan Naali Tateeharee Kiu Pahouchai Daurhee.
translation: How a plover can fly equal to a swan.

gurmukhi: swvix vx hrIAwvly Aku jMmY AauVI
transliteration: Saavani Van Hareeaavalay Aku Janmai Aurhee.
translation: The whole of the forest goes green in rainy season (sit-van) but akk, the wild plant of sandy region (calotropis procera) grows in the period of drought.

gurmukhi: bymuK suKu nw dyKeI ijau CutiV CauVI ]6]
transliteration: Baymoukh Soukhu N Daykhaee Jiu Chhoutarhi Chhaurhee ?6?
translation: The apostate cannot have happiness like an abandoned woman.

gurmukhi: 7 bymuK dI sMgq dw Pl
translation: The result of company of an apostate

gurmukhi: ByfY pUCil ligAwN ikau pwir lMGIAY
transliteration: Bhaydai Poochhali Lagiaan Kiu Paari Lagheeai.
translation: How one could get across the water by catching hold of the tail of a sheep.

gurmukhi: BUqY kyrI dosqI inq shsw jIAY
transliteration: Bhootai Kayree Dosatee Nit Sahasaa Jeeai.
translation: Friendship with a ghost is always a source of suspicious life.

gurmukhi: ndI iknwrY ruKVw vyswhu nw kIAY
transliteration: Nadee Kinaarai Roukharhaa Vaysaahu N Keeai.
translation: The tree on a river bank cannot have the faith (that the river will not perish it).

gurmukhi: imrqk nwil vIAwhIAY sohwgu n QIAY
transliteration: Miratak Naali Veeaaheeai Sohaagu N Deeai.
translation: How a woman married to a dead person could be said to be a suhagin, i.e one whose husband is alive.

gurmukhi: ivsu hlwhl bIij kY ikau Aimau lhIAY
transliteration: Visu Halaahal Beeji Kai Kiu Amiu Laheeai.
translation: How nectar could be obtained by sowing poison.

gurmukhi: bymuK syqI iprhVI jm fMfu shIAY ]7]
transliteration: Baymoukh Saytee Piraharhee Jam Dandu Saheeai ?7?
translation: The friendship with an apostate brings the sufferings of the rod of Yama.

gurmukhi: 8 bymuK Awp doSI hY
translation: The apostate himself is a culprit

gurmukhi: korVu moTu n irJeI kir AgnI josu
transliteration: Korarhu Motdu N Rijhaee Kari Aganee Josu.
translation: When moth, an Indian pulse is cooked over the fire some grains being hard remain uncooked.

gurmukhi: shs Plhu ieku ivgVY qrvr kI dosu
transliteration: Sahas Phalahu Iku Vigarhai Taravar Kee Dosu.
translation: This is not the fault of the fire. If one fruit out of a thousand go bad, it is not the fault of the tree.

gurmukhi: itbY nIru nw TwhrY Gix vris gieEsu
transliteration: Tibai Neeru N Tdaaharai Ghani Varasi Gaiaosu.
translation: It is not the fault of water that it will not rest on a hill.

gurmukhi: ivxu sMjim rogI mrY iciq vYd n rosu
transliteration: Vinu Sanjami Rogee Marai Chiti Vaid N Rosu.
translation: If a sick person die from not observing the regimen prescribed for him, it is not the fault of the doctor.

gurmukhi: AivAwvr n ivAwpeI msqik iliKEsu
transliteration: Aviaavar N Viaapaee Masataki Likhiaosu.
translation: If a barren woman have no offspring, it is her destiny and not the fault of her husband.

gurmukhi: bymuK pVHY n ielm ijau Avgux siB Esu ]8]
transliteration: Baymoukh Parhhai N Ilam Jioun Avagoun Sabhiaosu ?8?
translation: In the same way if a perverse man accept not the Guru's instruction, it is his own fault and not the Guru's.

gurmukhi: 9 bymuK dI kmweI doSI hY
translation: The earning of an apostate is defective

gurmukhi: AMnHY cMdu n idseI jig joiq sbweI
transliteration: Annhai Chandu N Disaee Jagi Joti Sabaaee.
translation: The blind cannot see the moon though its light scatters all around.

gurmukhi: bolw rwgu n smJeI ikhu Git n jweI
transliteration: Bolaa Raagu N Samajhaee Kihu Ghati N Jaaee.
translation: The music loses not its melody if a deaf cannot understand it.

gurmukhi: vwsu n AwvY guxguxY prmlu mihkweI
transliteration: Vaasu N Aavai Gounagounai Paramalu Mahikaaee.
translation: In spite of plenty of fragrance, the person without power of smell cannot enjoy the same.

gurmukhi: guMgY jIB nw auGVY siB sbid suhweI
transliteration: Goungai Jeev N Ougharhai Sabhi Sabadi Suhaaee.
translation: The word resides in one and all, but the dumb cannot move his tongue (to pronounce it).

gurmukhi: siqguru swgru syiv kY iniD sBnw pweI
transliteration: Satiguru Saagaru Sayvi Kai Nidhi Sabhanaan Paaee.
translation: The true Guru is an ocean and the true servants receive treasures out of it.

gurmukhi: bymuK hiQ GGUitAw iqsu dosu kmweI ]9]
transliteration: Baymoukh Hadi Ghaghootiaan Tisu Dosu Kamaaee ?9?
translation: The apostates get ',the shells only because their cultivation and labour is defective.

gurmukhi: 10 bymuK dy msqk dw rUp
translation: Nature of the apostate

gurmukhi: rqn aupMny swierhu BI pwxI Kwrw
transliteration: Ratan Oupannay Saairahu Bhee Paanee Khaaraa.
translation: Jewels have come out of sea but still its water is brackish.

gurmukhi: suJhu suJin iqin loA AaulMgu ivickwrw
transliteration: Sujhahu Sujhani Tini Loa Aulagu Vichikaaraa.
translation: In the light of moon, the three worlds are seen, yet the stigma on moon persists.

gurmukhi: DrqI aupjY AMnu Dnu ivic klru Bwrw
transliteration: Dharatee Oupajai Annu Dhanu Vichi Kalaru Bhaaraa.
translation: The earth produces the corn but still alkaline earth is also there.

gurmukhi: eIsru qusY hornw Gir Kpru Cwrw
transliteration: Eesaru Tousai Horanaa Ghari Khaparu Chhaaraa.
translation: Siva, getting happy, grants boons to others but in his own home only ashes and begging bowl are found.

gurmukhi: ijauN hxvMiq kCotVw ikAw krY ivcwrw
transliteration: Jioun Hanavanti Kachhotarhaa Kiaa Karai Vichaaraa.
translation: The powerful Hanuman can do a lot for others but has only a loincloth to wear.

gurmukhi: bymuK msqik iliKAw kauxu mytxhwrw ]10]
transliteration: Baymoukh Masataki Likhiaa Kaounu Maytanahaaraa ?10?
translation: Who can efface the words of destiny of the apostate.

gurmukhi: 11 bymuK JUTw hY
translation: The apostate is a tier

gurmukhi: gwNeI Gir goswNeIAwN mwDwxu GVwey
transliteration: Gaanee Ghari Gosaaneeaan Maadhaanu Gharhaaay.
translation: The cow herds are there in the house of the master, the foolish person continues getting the churning sticks made for his own home.

gurmukhi: GoVy suix saudwgrwN cwbk muil Awey
transliteration: Ghorhay Souni Saudaagaraan Chaabak Muli Aaay.
translation: The horses are with the merchants and the foolish person roams around purchasing the whips.

gurmukhi: dyiK prwey BwjvwV Gir gwhu Gqwey
transliteration: Daykhi Paraaay Bhaajavaarh Ghari Gaahu Ghataaay.
translation: Foolish person creates stampede at his home only by seeing the harvest of others around the threshing floor.

gurmukhi: suienw hit srwP dy suinAwr sdwey
transliteration: Suinaa Hati Saraadh Day Souniaar Sadaaay.
translation: The gold is with the gold merchant but the foolish calls for the goldsmith at his own home for preparing the jewellery.

gurmukhi: AMdir FoeI nw lhY bwhir bwPwey
transliteration: Andari Ddhoee Naa Lahai Baahari Baadhaaay.
translation: He has no place at home, but goes on boasting outside.

gurmukhi: bymuK bdl Cwv hY kUVo Awlwey ]11]
transliteration: Baymoukh Badal Chaal Hai Koorho Aalaaay ?11?
translation: The apostate is unstable like the speedy cloud and goes on telling lies.

gurmukhi: 12 bymuK- KwlI ho igAw
translation: The apostate is empty-

gurmukhi: mKxu lieAw ivroilkY Cwih CutiV hoeI
transliteration: Makhanu Laiaa Viroli Kai Chhaahi Chhoutarhi Hoee.
translation: When the butter is churned and taken away, the butter milk (lassi) is abandoned.

gurmukhi: pIV leI rsu gMinAhuN iClu CuhY n koeI
transliteration: Peerh Laee Rasu Ganniahu Chhilu Chhuhai N Koee.
translation: When the juice of sugarcane is extracted out, nobody touches the bagasse.

gurmukhi: rMgu mjIThu inklY AFu lhY n soeI
transliteration: Rangu Majeetdahu Nikalai Addhu Lahai N Soee.
translation: When the fast colour of Rubia munjista is taken away then nobody cares for it even worth a penny.

gurmukhi: vwsu leI PulvwVIAhu iPir imlY n FoeI
transliteration: Vaasu Laee Phulavaarheeahu Dhiri Milai N Ddhoee.
translation: When the fragrance of flowers is exhausted, no more shelter they get.

gurmukhi: kwieAw hMsu ivCuMinAw iqsu ko n sQoeI
transliteration: Kaaiaa Hansu Vichhounniaa Tisu Ko N Sadoee.
translation: When the atman separates from the body, no companion of the body remains.

gurmukhi: bymuK suky ruK ijauN vyKY sB loeI ]12]
transliteration: Baymoukh Soukay Roukh Jioun Vaykhai Sabh Loee ?12?
translation: It is clear to everyone that the apostate is like drywood (which can only be pushed into fire).

gurmukhi: 13 bymuK ik`kUM swDIdw hY
translation: How the apostate could be set right

gurmukhi: ijau kir KUhhu inklY gil bDy pwxI
transliteration: Jiu Kari Khoohahu Nikalai Gali Badhay Paanee.
translation: The water is drawn out of well only when the pitcher is tied from the neck (with rope).

gurmukhi: ijau mix kwly sp isir his dyie n jwxI
transliteration: Jiu Mani Kaalay Sap Siri Hasi Dayi N Jaanee.
translation: The cobra does not happily give away the jewel in the head (it gives only after getting killed).

gurmukhi: jwx kQUrI imrg qin mir mukY AwxI
transliteration: Jaan Kadooree Mirag Tani Mari Moukai Aanee.
translation: The deer also gives musk only after its death.

gurmukhi: qyl iqlhu ikau inklY ivxu pIVy GwxI
transliteration: Tayl Tilahu Kiu Nikalai Vinu Peerhay Ghaanee.
translation: The deer also gives musk only after its death.

gurmukhi: ijau muhu BMny grI dy nlIeyru inswxI
transliteration: Jiu Muhu Bhannay Garee Day Naleeayru Nisaanee.
translation: The kernel of coconut can be got only when its mouth is broken.

gurmukhi: bymuK lohw swDIAY vgdI vwdwxI ]13]
transliteration: Baymoukh Lohaa Saadheeai Vagadee Vaadaanee ?13?
translation: The apostate is such an iron that can be given desired shape only with the strokes of hammer.

gurmukhi: 14 bymuK dw sB kuC pu`Tw hY
translation: The apostate is always inverted)

gurmukhi: mhurw imTw AwKIAY ruTI no quTI
transliteration: Mahuraa Mitdaa Aakheeai Routdee No Toutdee.
translation: The foolish would say the poison sweet and the angry person a happy one.

gurmukhi: buiJAw vfw vKwxIAY swvwrI kuTI
transliteration: Bujhiaa Vadaa Vakhaaneeai Savaaree Koutdee.
translation: To the extinguished lamp he says the enlarged one and a killed goat to him is dressed one.

gurmukhi: jilAw TMFw geI no AweI qy auTI
transliteration: Jaliaa Tdaddhaa Gaee No Aaee Tay Outdee.
translation: To burnt he would say the cooled one: the 'gone' for him is 'come' and the 'come' one for him is eloped one i.e. if something sets in the eye, the eye is said to be soaring and if a widow settles in someone's house by marrying him, she is said to have elo

gurmukhi: Ahmku Bolw AwKIAY sB gil ApuTI
transliteration: Ahamaku Bholaa Aakheeai Sabh Gali Apoutdee.
translation: To moron he would say simple, and his all talks will be contrary to normal.

gurmukhi: aujVu qRtI bymuKwN iqsu AwKin vuTI
transliteration: Ujarhu Tratee Baymoukhaan Tisu Aakhani Voutdee.
translation: To the ruining person, the foolish would say that he is leaving everything of his own sweet will.

gurmukhi: corY sMdI mwau ijauN luik rovY guTI ]14]
transliteration: Chorai Sandee Maaoun Jioun Louki Rovai Moutdee ?14?
translation: Such people are like the mother of a thief who weeps hiding in a corner (lest she is detected and possibility of catching hold of her son increases).

gurmukhi: 15 bymuK dI sMgq dw Pl
translation: Result of the association of apostates

gurmukhi: vVIAY kjl koTVI muhu kwlK BrIAY
transliteration: Varheeai Kajal Kotdarhee Muhu Kaalakh Bhareeai.
translation: If someone enters a room full of soot his face is sure to be blackened.

gurmukhi: klir KyqI bIjIAY ikhu kwju nw srIAY
transliteration: Kalari Khaytee Beejeeai Kihu Kaaju N Sareeai.
translation: If seed be sown in the alkaline field, that will go useless.

gurmukhi: tutI pINGY pINGIAY pY toey mrIAY
transliteration: Toutee Peenghai Peengheeai Pai Toay Mareeai.
translation: If somebody swings in a broken swing, he will fall \and kill himself.

gurmukhi: kMnw PiV mnqwrUAwN ikau duqru qrIAY
transliteration: Kannaan Dharhi Manataarooaan Kiu Doutaru Tareeai.
translation: If a man who does not know how to swim, leans on the shoulders of another equally ignorant, how shall he cross a deep river?

gurmukhi: Aig lwie mMdir svY iqsu nwil n PrIAY
transliteration: Agi Laai Mandari Savai Tisu Naali N Dhareeai.
translation: Move not with him who sets fire to his own house and then goes to sleep.

gurmukhi: iqauN Tg sMgiq bymuKwN jIA joKhu frIAY ]15]
transliteration: Tioun Tdag Sangati Baymoukhaan Jeea Jokhahu Dareeai ?15?
translation: Such is the society of the deceitful and apostates wherein man is ever in fear of his life.

gurmukhi: 16 bymuK Gor pwpI hn
translation: The apostate is a big sinner

gurmukhi: bwmHx gwNeI vMs Gwq AprwD krwry
transliteration: Baamhan Gaanee Vans Ghaat Aparaadh Karaaray.
translation: (It is said that) The killing of brahmin, cow and the man of one's own family is a deadly sin.

gurmukhi: mdu pI jUey Kyldy johin prnwry
transliteration: Madu Pee Jooay Khayladay Johani Par Naaray.
translation: The drunkards gamble and look at the wives of others.

gurmukhi: muhin prweI lCmI Tg cor cgwry
transliteration: Muhani Paraaee Lakhimee Tdag Chor Chagaaray.
translation: The thieves and decoits loot other's wealth.

gurmukhi: ivsws DRohI AikrqGix pwpI hiqAwry
transliteration: Visaas Dhrohee Akirataghan Paapee Hatiaaray.
translation: These all are treacherous, ungrateful, sinners and killers.

gurmukhi: lK kroVI joVIAin Axgxq Apwry
transliteration: Lakh Karorhee Jorheeani Anaganat Apaaray.
translation: If such persons are gathered in infinite number;

gurmukhi: iekqu lUie n pujnI bymuK gurduAwry ]16]
transliteration: Ikatu Looi N Pujanee Baymoukh Guraduaaray ?16?
translation: Even they all are not equal to the single hair of the apostate.

gurmukhi: 17 bymuKqweI dI h`qRXw lihNdI nhIN
translation: The sin of apostasy does not get off

gurmukhi: gMg jmun godwvrI kulKyq isDwry
transliteration: Gang Jamoun Godaavaree Kulakhayt Sidhaaray.
translation: If one goes to the Ganges, Yamuna, Godavari and Kurukshetr.

gurmukhi: mQurw mwieAw AjuiDAw kwNsI kydwry
transliteration: Maduraa Maaiaa Ayudhiaa Kaasee Kaydaaray.
translation: Mathure, Mayapuri, Ayodhya , Kasi, Kedarnath are also visited.

gurmukhi: gieAw iprwg srsuqI gomqI duAwry
transliteration: Gaiaa Piraag Sarasoutee Gomatee Duaaray.
translation: The door of Gomati, Sarasvati, Prayag. Gaya is too approached.

gurmukhi: jpu qpu sMjmu hom jig sB dyv juhwry
transliteration: Japu Tapu Sanjamu Hom Jagi Sabh Dayv Juhaaray.
translation: All sort of rectations, penances, continences, yajns, homs are practised and all the gods are eulogised.

gurmukhi: AKI prxY jy BvY iqhu loA mJwry
transliteration: Akhee Paranai Jay Bhavai Tihu Loa Majhaarai.
translation: The eyes putting on earth if even the three worlds are visited.

gurmukhi: mUil n auqrY hiqAw bymuK gurduAwry ]17]
transliteration: Mooli N Outarai Hatiaa Baymoukh Guraduaaray ?17?
translation: Even then the sin of apostasy never fades out.

gurmukhi: 18 siqgur bwJ suK nhIN
translation: No happiness without true Guru

gurmukhi: kotIN swdIN kyqVy jMgl BUpwlw
transliteration: Koteen Saadeen Kaytarhay Jangal Bhoopaalaa.
translation: Many are engrossed in myriad of tastes, and many are the kings of the forests.

gurmukhi: QlIN vroly kyqVy prbq byqwlw
transliteration: Daleen Varolay Kaytarhay Parabat Baytaalaa.
translation: Many are the places, whirlwinds, mountains and the ghosts.

gurmukhi: ndIAwN nwly kyqVy srvr Asrwlw
transliteration: Nadeeaan Naalay Kaytarhay Saravar Asaraalaa.
translation: Many are the rivers, streams and the deep tanks.

gurmukhi: AMbir qwry kyqVy ibsIAru pwqwlw
transliteration: Anbari Taaray Kaytarhay Biseearu Paataalaa.
translation: The sky has many a star and in the nether world innumerable are the serpents.

gurmukhi: BMBlBUsy BuilAwN Bvjl Brnwlw
transliteration: Bhanbhal Bhoosay Bhuliaan Bhavajal Bharanaalaa.
translation: Many are wandering confused in the labyrinth of world.

gurmukhi: ieksu siqgur bwhry siB Awl jMjwlw ]18]
transliteration: Ikasu Satigur Baaharay Sabhi Aal Janjaalaa ?18?
translation: Without one true Guru all else are perplexities.

gurmukhi: 19 bymuK kyNdR hIn hn
translation: The apostate is centreless

gurmukhi: bhuqI GrIN prwhuxw ijau rhdw BuKw
transliteration: Bahouteen Ghareen Paraahounaa Jiu Rahandaa Bhoukhaa.
translation: A guest of many houses remains hungry.

gurmukhi: swNJw bbu n roeIAY iciq icMq n cuKw
transliteration: Saanjh Babu N Roeeai Chiti Chint N Choukhaa.
translation: On the loss of common father of many, scant are the weeping and mental anxieties.

gurmukhi: bhlI fUmI FF ijau Ehu iksY n DuKw
transliteration: Bahalee Doomee Ddhaddhi Jiu Aohu Kisai N Dhoukhaa.
translation: When many drummers strike a drum, no one is pleased with the discordant voices.

gurmukhi: vix vix kwauN n soheI ikau mwxY suKw
transliteration: Vani Vani Kaaoun N Sohaee Kioun Maanai Soukhaa.
translation: How could a crow wandering from forest to forest be happy and honourable.

gurmukhi: ijau bhu imqI vysuAw qin vydin duKw
transliteration: Jiu Bahu Mitee Vaysuaa Tani Vaydani Doukhaa.
translation: As a prostitute's body suffers from having many lovers,

gurmukhi: ivxu gur pUjin hornw brny bymuKw ]19]
transliteration: Vinu Gur Poojani Horanaa Baranay Baymoukhaa ?19?
translation: Those who worship others than the Guru are unhappy in their apostasy.

gurmukhi: 20 AxhoNdw grbI BUq hY
translation: The egotist is a ghost

gurmukhi: vwie suxwey CwnxI iqsu auT auTwly
transliteration: Vaai Sounaaay Chhaananee Tisu Outd Outdaalay.
translation: With the sound of the seive it is vain to cause the camel to get up.

gurmukhi: qwVI mwir frwieMdw mYNgl mqvwly
transliteration: Taarhee Maari Daraaindaa Maingal Matavaalay.
translation: Frightening the elephant with the clappings of the hands is as futile

gurmukhi: bwsik nwgY swmHxw ijauN dIvw bwly
transliteration: Baasaki Naagai Saamhanaa Jioun Deevaa Baalay.
translation: As burning of the lamp before a VÃ¤suki cobra (in the hope that it will run away).

gurmukhi: sIhuM srjY shw ijauN AKI vyKwly
transliteration: Seehoun Sarajai Sahaa Jioun Akheen Vaykhaalay.
translation: If rabbit looking into the eyes wishes to frighten the lion (it is nothing but a deathwish).

gurmukhi: swier lhir n pujnI pwxI prnwly
transliteration: Saair Lahari N Pujanee Paanee Paranaalay.
translation: Small water conduit pipes can not be equal to the ocean.

gurmukhi: Axhodw Awpu gxwiedy mymuK byqwly ]20]
transliteration: Anahondaa Aapu Ganaainday Baymoukh Baytaalay ?20?
translation: Like ghost, the apostate being nothing goes on expressing his ego.

gurmukhi: 21 bymuKwN nwl AVnw insPl hY
translation: It is useless to quarrel with the apostates

gurmukhi: nwir Bqwrhu bwhrI suiK syj nw cVIAY
transliteration: Naari Bhataarahu Baaharee Soukhi Sayj N Charheeai.
translation: Without husband a woman cannot enjoy pleasures of bed.

gurmukhi: puqu n mMnY mwipAwN kmjwqIN vVIAY
transliteration: Poutu N Mannai Maapiaan Kamajaateen Varheeai.
translation: If the son disobeys the parents, he is considered a bastard.

gurmukhi: vxjwrw swhhu iPrY vyswhu n jVIAY
transliteration: Vanajaaraa Saahahoun Dhirai Vaysaahu N Jarheeai.
translation: If a merchant does not keep his word given to his banker, he loses his faith.

gurmukhi: swihbu sauhYN Awpxy hQIAwru n PVIAY
transliteration: Saahibu Sauhain Aapanay Hadiaaru N Dharheeai.
translation: Take not arms against your master.

gurmukhi: kUVu n phuMcY sc no sau GwVq GVIAY
transliteration: Koorhu N Pahounchai Sach No Sau Ghaarhat Gharheeai.
translation: The falsehood can never reach the truth even if hundred excuses are made.

gurmukhi: muMdRwN kMin ijnwVIAwN iqnHwN nwil n AVIAY ]21]34]
transliteration: Moundraan Kanni Jinaarheeaan Tin Naali N Arheeai ?21?34?chaouteeha?
translation: One should not behave stubbornly before the people wearing earrings (because they are most obdurate ones).

gurmukhi: durmiq myit gurmiq ihrdY pRgwsI Koey hY AigAwn jwny bHm igAwn hY
transliteration: Duramati Mayti Gurmati Hiradai Pragaasee , Khoay Hai Agiaan Jaanay Braham Giaan Hai ?
translation: WhenÂ aÂ discipleÂ meetsÂ hisÂ GuruÂ andÂ heÂ worksÂ hardÂ andÂ toilÂ himselfÂ onÂ hisÂ precepts,Â heÂ getsÂ ridÂ ofÂ baseÂ intellectÂ andÂ divineÂ intelligenceÂ isÂ revealedÂ toÂ him.Â HeÂ shedsÂ hisÂ ignoranceÂ andÂ acquiresÂ HisÂ knowledge.

gurmukhi: drs iDAwn Awn iDAwn ibsmrn kY sbd suriq moin bRq prvwny hY
transliteration: Daras Dhiaan Aan Dhiaan Bisamaran Kai , Sabad Surati Moni Brat Paravaanay Hai ?
translation: ByÂ theÂ glimpseÂ ofÂ theÂ TrueÂ GuruÂ andÂ focusingÂ hisÂ mind,Â heÂ weansÂ awayÂ hisÂ attentionÂ fromÂ worldlyÂ pleasuresÂ andÂ concentratesÂ theÂ divineÂ wordÂ inÂ hisÂ consciousnessÂ andÂ closesÂ hisÂ mindÂ fromÂ allÂ otherÂ attractions.

gurmukhi: pRym rs risk hie An rs rhq huie joqI mY joiq srUp sohM sur qwny hY
transliteration: Praym Ras Rasik Ha?i An Ras Rahat Hui , Jotee Mai Joti Saroop Sohan Sur Taanay Hai ?
translation: InÂ HisÂ love,Â leavingÂ allÂ worldlyÂ pleasures,Â gettingÂ absorbedÂ inÂ HisÂ Naam,Â heÂ keepsÂ onÂ rememberingÂ HimÂ allÂ theÂ time.

gurmukhi: gur isK sMD imly bIs iekIs eIs pUrn ibbyk tyk eyk hIXy Awny hY ]34]
transliteration: Gur Sikh Sandh Milay Bees Ikees Eesa , Pooran Bibayk Tayk Ayk Heeyay Aanay Hai ?34?
translation: BelieveÂ itÂ forÂ SureÂ thatÂ byÂ meetingÂ withÂ Guru,Â aÂ GuruÂ consciousÂ personÂ becomesÂ oneÂ withÂ LordÂ andÂ allÂ hisÂ lifeÂ dependsÂ onÂ NaamÂ Simran-anÂ exclusiveÂ supportÂ ofÂ theÂ Lord.Â (34)
